transcript.content: Horse polo, where I think - I don't think you - there's a stick long enough, I think the elephants kick it don't they?
I think you might be right, I think they're not allowed to use their tusks.
Ricky imitates the sound of a ball deflating
What do you mean the elephants kick it?
Alright, I've got - I've opened a can of worms here. Right, you know, um, um, normal polo on a horse? They have like...
Yeah. They whack 'em, right? But I think they, obviously they're too high up. I think, I - I - I might be wrong but I'm pretty sure they just train the elephant to kick it.
So, what - why are people sat on their back? Why not just let them have a kick about without...?
Imagine that! And why does horse racing have to have a jockey? Why don't they just have their horses go on y- okay lads, on your - no cheating!
On your marks, get set, go! You..! Uh! Get back here! Get back here! Brilliant. Play a record.
Yeah. Oh, this is absolutely fantastic.
His version of Wonderwall. If you've not heard it before you'll be loving it.
This is the best of show on XFM 104.9 and I'm Ricky Gervais, with me is Stephen Merchant.
I hope you're enjoying the 'Best Of'.
There's a fellow who erm, was in a coma for twenty years.

Just - they, they kept, like taking him to - through like the normal day. They'd take him to Alton Towers and stuff. He didn't know anything about it, just kept going through the motions. Erm, dunno if they kept charging him? Erm, kept putting him through all that. He eventually came out of it. Twenty years.
And went "Stop taking me to Alton Towers, it's shit!"
I just - I just thought imagine how much post he had.
Did you read about that guy in the paper, Karl? He, um.
Sorry, on the internet. Uh, he, in - in about I think it was about 1984-85? He had a terrible car accident.
This must be what he's talking about?
Well, they didn't take him to Alton Towers.

Course they didn't! But you've gotta try and decipher the truth from the conjecture - from the thing that he - I mean, don't forget that Karl says - realises that he's had a dream, he's talking to Suzanne and goes "That was good, wasn't it last night When we were in the plane?" and goes "No that was a dream", he goes "Oh yeah, where's me corn flakes?"
You've gotta - you know what I mean? I can now decipher what he's actually seen, what he's read...
But go on, what - what did you see?
Well, I'm assuming it's the same guy.
There's a guy in the, uh, there's a guy in some small American town.
And he's had a car crash and he's gone into a coma and his, uh, wife had uh, left him. She's gone on with her life. Cos he's been in a coma since then and he had just woken up recently.
Marriage wasn't working. He just wasn't paying her enough attention.
He actually had - she was pregnant at the time, so now his daughter - his now - his daughter is basically the same age as he was when he went into the coma.

And um, he's just started coming around, he's just started making jokes. He said - they said, uh, "How do you feel?", he said "Horny." which I thought was quite witty for man who's been in a coma for, uh, many years. Um, but anyway, yeah, so he's slowly trying to rebuild, uh, what life he ca- he can.
What do you make of that though? Cos he - the thing is that - he's missed... Imagine what he's missed, Karl. Imagine the music that he's missed...
Live Aid, he's missed. The Spice Girls.
He's missed, uh, Phil Collins playing in two continents in one day.
Frankly I'd be devastated if I discovered I missed that.
And he's not a gay fella?

No. Well, no. I mean, you know, I don't know about Nero but I mean it wasn't - it wasn't the case of a big delineation between what was heterosexual and what was gay. It was just - you know, whatever your --
So, what - what did this fella do then? This one who's havin' his --
Well he was - he was pretty much top - top boy, Nero, for a while.
And uh, you know, and they - you did what - you did what you were told. If uh, Caesar or, you know --
Well, why were people going 'round there, why didn't they go, "Oh" --

No, they weren't droppin' in. They - it wasn't like the door's open, "I'm just gonna see what Nero's doing." You'd probably been like a delivery boy or a stable boy or something, you know? And you'd have popped 'round there and you would've gone, "You right, Nero? There's the - there's the tablets of stone you wanted." And he'll go, "Pilkington, while you are here, pop on" - I don't know why he's French.
I don't know why's hes French. "Just pop under the water and nibble at my testicles", and you would've done it.
There's no - there's no way I would've done.
What have I done, I've dropped a pizza off? Why - why am I there?
Yeah, you've dropped 'round to Nero's place with a pizza.
Right, right, I'd - I'd say, "I've done me job."
"That's not the sort of tip I wanted."
Yeah, no. He'd have said, "Get the little baldy chap to nibble at my testicles" and you'd have gone under the water.
No, I wouldn't, I wouldn't have done it.
Well, you'd have your head underwater for Nero.
No, I wouldn't have done that, so --

Can I just say this, Steve? Not only would you be nibbling at his testicles, you'd have been going mad, you'd have been noshing him just for extra - you'd have had a - you'd be doing everything he wanted. You'd have been going - he'd have gone, "I didn't ask you to do that!" You'd have been going mental, there'd have been chewing, slurping --
-- smacking, poking, you'd have chopped - you'd have - you'd have gnawed his --
-- packet off. You'd think you were eating Walkers Crisps. There'd be bubbles, there'd be - oh, it'd have been horrible.

That was Bowie, Waterloo Sunset. Love that. Love the original. Love Bowie. Bowie was my gig of the year. These are my singles of the year, these are our clips of the year. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Stephen Merchant.
We're just picking some lovely little bits and pieces.
Do you remember when we talked about this?
That's the sort of thing I think we need now, right? We've covered a lot of stuff.
Well - okay, um, what - what do you wanna know?
Have you got something? Can you educate us on anything?
I've been reading bits and bobs.
So could we bring back - just for one - one - for one night only, Educating Ricky?
Do you think it warrants that?
I don't - I don't know enough about it. Do you know what I mean?
It sounds perfect, play the jingle.
Oh, Educating Ricky! He's getting smarter.
Couple of things happened in the week that I read about.
Keeping up on what's going on and that.
Uh, one was about - about that Galileo fella.
I think it might've been earlier.
-- did stuff with light and that? Is he, uh --
Yep, he did lots of physical experiments, yeah.
Is that it then, Karl, is it?
He did - he did some stuff with light and that?
Well, what did he do with light? What was that?
Well, he did - he - well, he, uh - I think he invented the first --

-- uh, yeah, telescopes. So, I don't - I - I - I think it's a particular lens though, that that - um, and uh, he did experiments where he dropped two - um, famously, two different uh, weighted, uh, balls from pizza - Pisa. And uh, they hit the ground at the same time, showing that the - it doesn't matter. The weight doesn't matter. Air resistance does and stuff like that.
I think he probably explained it a bit better than that.
Yeah. But I'm talking to Karl.
Did - did - did they need to know stuff --
Did they need to know stuff like that back then?
What do you mean, "Did they need to know stuff like that?" It's just - it's just --
There weren't people going around going, "I've gotta drop these two things off the bleeding Tower of Pisa, I just don't know which one's gonna land first."
I don't - yeah, "I need to know." "Why'd you need to know that?"
No, but if I was knocking about then, I'd be like, "Stop messing with that, we need a telly" or - do you know what I mean?
I bet he thinks the Flintstones is real.
Like, "That'd be brilliant, that's what I'd do if I was a caveman, I'd make a telly out of rock."
"And a pelican as a cement mixer."
"And a car that I'd just ran along the road with."
Ex - yeah, exactly, yeah, "We need a car!"
"Well, we haven't really got the internal combustion engine, can you stick your feet through the bottom?" "Yeah, just get me a car for Christ's sake!"
Anyway, so I learnt that. And then um --
Other people I know the name of this week --
Brilliant. Oh, if a chimp could watch telly. Go on, Karl, go on.
And there was also a fella in the week who said uh, that women shouldn't be wearing trousers.
'Cause they don't look good in 'em. What do you think - what do you think about that?
These are the only things that have caught your eye over the last couple of weeks? This is the entire news?
Galileo did something with light, a French fella said women shouldn't wear trousers. See that - that, to me, wouldn't pass as education.
I don't know where you could ever use that. I don't know whether - if that would ever be applicable to life.
I just - I just like reading stuff that sort of reminds me of - do you know what I mean, if I read it and it gets me thinking, I think that's - that's a good little piece.

But I mean - but surely me - sure - can't you just, like - like, sit near something that vibrates to keep your brain going or shake your head every now and again? I mean, what - what does this do? You mean, it makes you start using your brain?
But what aspect of the, "A frenchman said women shouldn't wear trousers" got your mind working? What questions were you asking?
Because I thought that's - that's a bit - that's a bit daft, innit? Right?
Okay, it ends there with me. There's nothing else - there's nowhere else for me to go on that.
Yeah, go on, what did you think? Let - let's go through this. Oh, I wish we could download his thoughts.
I - I - wouldn't it be great? Like a DVD of that.
Imagine that extra footage on The Office DVD, Karl --
-- women wearing - wearing trousers and that, right? On the estate that I grew up in --
-- on - on, right? Uh, there was a woman about four houses down, right? Rough. Now, she used to wear leggings. Now, they're a bad idea.
They are a terrible idea, I agree with you there, Karl. If you are a lady of --

-- "up a woman's skirt, with a hidden camera while on duty. The 42-year-old sergeant, who's not been named, used a digital camera to secretly snap the shots when the woman was reporting a stolen bicycle."

He was actually doing his proper job, he'd obviously thought to himself, "I'll bring in me digital camera today on the off-chance a beautiful woman comes in to report a crime or robbery, I'll have it ready, I'll have it positioned, you know" --
-- "in such a way." But this is interesting, this is how he got caught, okay? "The woman became suspicious after she saw a flash go off."
"Sorry, did I just see your shoe - your shoe just seemed to just spring into life there, there was light. There was light coming from your shoe."
"Yeah, I think I'd had some - I'd - someone set fire to some magnesium or something, did it? It won't happen again."
"No, no, no. There's only - there's only you and I in here, and your shoe was" --
"Why are you standing like that? Why is your shoe just sort of, like, between my feet?"
"There's no reason, this is how I always stand."
"There's no reason, just - just - where - what did the bike look like?" Flash. "Sir, are you taking pictures of my fanny?"
"No. No, no, no, no, no. And no I'm not, and you should be wearing knickers anyway."
"I didn't know you - I don't know what you've got up there."
"I don't know what it looks like, and I know - there's no way I could." 'Course that - it would be the rough of that conversation in Japanese.
You know, um - you just mentioned there about, sort of, no knickers and that.
Is this gonna be your Aunty Nora?
It's just - do you know, like, the - the last flat that I lived in, I always had a good view across the road and I could see, uh, there was the hairy - hairy --
There was the hairy Chinese kid.
Well, not hairy Chinese kid, he was just a Chinese kid, actually.
Yeah. 'Cause that's rare, innit? A hairy Chinese kid's very rare, innit?
There's only one official sighting, isn't there?
In one of those shit little magazines that you buy. No, go on.
And there was the old woman who didn't move, she was just sat there reading a book all the time.
Who we think possibly had died and no one came around for weeks, yeah.
But - and now I've moved, right?
And it was quiet for a bit. I always look at what view I'm getting, right?
Uh, I'd looked across, there was just sort of empty sort of flats ready for people to move in, and that, right?

Anyway, people are in there now, right? Um, and they've put all the furniture in, but haven't put any curtains up, right? So anyway, I'm - I'm sort of washing up, just having a - having a look out the window.
Right? Uh, girl sort of, uh, wandering about. With no knickers on, right?
No knickers. Well, she had a bra on.
She was probably looking for her knickers.
So, I thought, "Oh." And I don't know how long I was looking.
Right? But anyway, she looks across.
I think, "Oh God." I felt really bad.
Sorry, is this some sort of peeping tom confession?
Well, it's - it's not - that's the thing, though.
If - if I was peeping, she was peeping as well 'cause she was looking over. It works both ways, dunnit?
Yeah, but - but you're - yeah, all she could see of you was your bald head.
No, no, but this is it --
And your hands moving as you were washing up. Yeah. And some white-looking substance frothing up.
"A particularly stubborn stain on this glass!" Oh God!
Imagine that! Imagine if she looked across! I'm assuming your sink is lower --
But, but di-didn't she just like, just cover up, or something? Or did she look back and go "Oh, you're looking - you're looking at my fanny?"
I thought, oh... Just, sort of drop me boxer shorts. Cos I thought...
Well, Suzanne said "What are you doing?".
What are you talking about!? What are you talking about!?
No! Just, just, just so they can see me cheeks of me... Arse.
No, just - because I thought, if she thinks I'm walking about in the nude as well, then we've both got something out of it.
This sounds like - this sounds like a bad excuse in court.
So, sorry, you immediately - so, you were looking at a woman dancing around naked, right?
So the only thing you could do was immediately drop your boxer shorts?
So, she looked across, saw you fully clothed, saw you took your boxers down?
No, she wouldn't have done. Because it's sort of just the top half and the sinks at a side angle so I was sort of looking outside.
So she wouldn't - so she wouldn't have seen your trousers down anyway?
No, she did. I moved in front of the window more.
You actually climbed in front of-
So you climbed in front of the window?
To show off your naked lower half?
Not that - it wasn't that obvious. Suzanne said "What are you doing?"
"I sent you in here to clean up!".

"What are you doing!?", "I'm just - I'm just taking my trousers down, standing on the window.", "Why?", "Because there's a naked woman across the road. What do you think I'm doing, Suzanne!? I'm exposing myself while looking at some free fanny!"
Leave it, leave it, leave it.
Wait a minute, can I just check?
A final question, what did the woman across the way - what happened? What was her reaction?
I didn't look again. I just thought "You-you've seen a bit of action as well. We're both happy, let's - let's leave it.".
So where you waddling around like a penguin with your trousers around your ankles?
I just was walking about and Suzanne said "What are you doing?", I said "I'll explain to you in a bit, just don't look out the window because then... It's obvious.".
Then her hus - then he sees - she calls her husband to look at Karl walking around naked, he goes "Oh, she's got her - quick, Suzanne! Get 'em out!".
"There's only one willing - get some more friends! They've gone one more!".
